intro: Sussodia oppositifolia, commonly known as the opposite-leaf sussodia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite leaf arrangement, where leaves are paired on either side of the stem. Its small, fragrant flowers are typically white or pale pink, and it produces small, round berries that are edible. Sussodia oppositifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments within the rainforests of Madagascar.
